nealrichardson commented on pull request #6407: ARROW-7834: [Release] Post release task for updating the documentations
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6407#discussion_r377986673
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/r_build.sh
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+set -ex
+
+: ${R_BIN:=R}
+source_dir=${1}/r
+with_docs=${2:-false}
+
+pushd ${source_dir}
+
+${R_BIN} CMD INSTALL .
+
+if [ "${with_docs}" == "true" ]; then
 
 Review comment:
   This feels hacky. Why not add a new script to build the docs instead of polluting this script?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on pull request #6407: ARROW-7834: [Release] Post release task for updating the documentations
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6407#discussion_r378179922
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/r_build.sh
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+set -ex
+
+: ${R_BIN:=R}
+source_dir=${1}/r
+with_docs=${2:-false}
+
+pushd ${source_dir}
+
+${R_BIN} CMD INSTALL .
+
+if [ "${with_docs}" == "true" ]; then
 
 Review comment:
   I know, your suggestion was my original idea. The issue is with the C GLib documentation [generation](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/scripts/c_glib_build.sh#L36) which is handled with the same meson command in the same script. To remain consistent with that the doc building functionality is built in the *_build.sh scripts.
   
   @kou could we factor out the glib doc generation to c_glib_docs.sh or something?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+set -ex
+
+: ${R_BIN:=R}
+source_dir=${1}/r
+with_docs=${2:-false}
+
+pushd ${source_dir}
+
+${R_BIN} CMD INSTALL .
+
+if [ "${with_docs}" == "true" ]; then
 
 Review comment:
   docs_build.sh already exists and that's where C++ and Python docs are generated. I'd put this in that script, right before the `rsync`. Whether or not you move the other doc generating to `docs_build.sh` or whether those remain as just rsync seems like a separate issue (you could try to clean that up if possible but seems not required)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org
